last_episode_to_air.name: New Hampshire
last_episode_to_air.overview: Jimmy returns to finalize the sale of the station and tries to persuade one staff member to relocate to New Hampshire with him.

name: NewsRadio
overview: The office politics and interpersonal relationships among the staff of WNYX NewsRadio, New York's #2 news radio station.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: A midwesterner gets a job as news director at a New York radio station.  He gets an odd reception when his boss wants him to fire his predecessor.

episodes.name: Inappropriate
episodes.overview: After sparks fly at dinner, Dave and Lisa try to hide their feelings from their co-workers.

episodes.name: Smoking
episodes.overview: A new law bans smoking in the workplace, to Bill's dismay.  Lisa thinks that Joe saw her and Dave at a movie.

episodes.name: The Crisis
episodes.overview: Dave deals with his first challenge as news director when a subway train is derailed. Back in the office, Matthew's new desk causes friction among the staffers, whom all want new desks.

episodes.name: Big Day
episodes.overview: Mr. James assigns Dave the task of doling out the annual bonuses. Each staffer gets the standard $400 bonus except for two, one of who receives a $3,000 'Big Bonus', the other gets 'The Shaft'. In the B-story, Bill complains to Dave about all the clutter that mysteriously finds its way to his desk.

episodes.name: Luncheon at the Waldorf
episodes.overview: Bill invites Beth on a lunch date which she accepts despite Lisa's fear that Bill will take advantage of her. The tables are turned when Beth sticks her tongue down Bill's throat. Dave tries to get to the bottom of WNYX's severely bloated financial problems.

episodes.name: Sweeps Week
episodes.overview: Dave's old girlfriend Nancy visits, still under the impression that she and Dave are an item. Meanwhile, Jimmy insists Bill interview a 'financial visionary'

episodes.name: No, This is Not Based Entirely on Julie's Life
episodes.overview: Beth takes erotic photographs or herself to energize her relationship with her boyfriend. Joe booby traps the refrigerator when someone continually steals his daily gelato.

episodes.name: Goofy Ball
episodes.overview: Jimmy gives Beth and Matthew a new product, a 'goofy ball', to test. Lisa decides it's time to tell Mr. James about her fling with Dave. Bill buys a stun gun from Joe when he fears he's being stalked.

episodes.name: Rat Funeral
episodes.overview: The staff is overly sentimental when Dave catches 'Mike', the office rat.

episodes.name: The Breakup
episodes.overview: Dave and Lisa have a fight after Dave calls her the 'b-word'. Beth manipulates the two into 'coming out' in front of the whole staff. Catherine finds out Bill's real first name.

episodes.name: The Shrink
episodes.overview: Jimmy brings in a psychiatrist when the staff is stressed out.

episodes.name: Friends
episodes.overview: Beth and her copycat friend fight for Matthew. Bill is plagued by security guards who refuse to let him enter the building without his ID.

episodes.name: Bill's Autobiography
episodes.overview: Bill is approached with a book deal to write his autobiography.

episodes.name: Negotiation
episodes.overview: Dave gives Matthew a in-name-only promotion to coordinating producer. Lisa looks for a temporary job as an MTV news anchor. Jimmy announces he's getting married and asks for help finding a wife.

episodes.name: The Cane
episodes.overview: Bill's new cane, which he carries for no particular reason, annoys Dave. After it's stolen, Dave is the target of Bill's wrath. Jimmy's all-night office brainstorms stokes Dave and Lisa's competitive fires. Matthew and Joe get on each other's nerves.

episodes.name: Xmas Story
episodes.overview: Matthew is upset when he realizes Mr. James gave everyone except him a new convertible for Christmas. Meanwhile Bill is stalked by a homicidal Santa Claus.

episodes.name: Station Sale
episodes.overview: Jimmy negotiates with a media conglomerate to sell the station so he can meet with their attractive representative. Matthew handcuffs himself to a chair to protest a sale, while the rest of the staff schemes up ways to keep their jobs.

episodes.name: Bitch Session
episodes.overview: Dave accidentally overhears the entire staff mocking and insulting him. Jimmy tries to lift Dave's spirits.

episodes.name: In Through the Out Door
episodes.overview: Dave introduces Bill at a Broadcasting Society event after taking speaking lessons from Bill. Matthew learns about gambling from Joe, falling $20,000 into debt.

episodes.name: The Song Remains the Same
episodes.overview: Mr. James disrupts the office with his early April Fools' Day practical jokes. Bill is interviewed by a Wall Street Journal reporter. Lisa and Matthew compete for the right to cover the New Hampshire primary.

episodes.name: Zoso
episodes.overview: Bill enlists Joe and Matthew's support to try to convince his girlfriend that he's British. Beth tries to sell 'Fat Albert'-style hats to a department store. Lisa uses Mr. James negotiating tips to ask Dave for a raise.

episodes.name: Houses of the Holy
episodes.overview: Joe does an admirable job filling in for an ill Catherine, much to Bill's dismay. Beth dates Mr. James' nephew who is a depressed motivational speaker, in a form of a magician.

episodes.name: Physical Graffiti
episodes.overview: Dave is jealous when Lisa constantly talks to her ex-boyfriend. Joe is the facilitator in a practical joke war between Catherine & Bill.

episodes.name: Led Zeppelin
episodes.overview: Dave and Lisa announce they're breaking up. Lisa insists any further communication be done in memorandum format. Dave tries to keep his 24-page memo private. Mr. James continues his wife search.

episodes.name: Presence
episodes.overview: Jimmy loses Bill in a poker game. Lisa competes in Jimmy's place to win him back. Joe uses a hidden camera inside a Boba Fett action figure to keep up with the action.

episodes.name: Coda
episodes.overview: Dave, Bill and Mr. James work on a promotional spot. Lisa helps Joe study for a test. Matthew tries to sign up people for a summer house in the Hamptons.

episodes.name: Led Zeppelin II
episodes.overview: A fire in the building sets everyone's nerves on edge. Bill tries to escape. Dave and Lisa get back together. Mr. James continues his wife search.

episodes.name: President
episodes.overview: Mr. James decides to run for President of the United States while Lisa declares to expose all of his secrets. Matthew grows a 70's style moustache to ""get chicks"".

episodes.name: Review
episodes.overview: A new coffee shop is opened on the first floor of the Criterion Building. Matthew becomes obsessed with Scott Adams' Dilbert cartoon.

guest_stars.character: Guy Pretending to Be Scott Adams
guest_stars.name: Michael Adler

episodes.name: Massage Chair
episodes.overview: Bill leads a revolution when Mr. James eliminates free snacks in the break room. Joe gives Catherine a variety of electronic gadgets to ingratiate himself with her. Bill buys a massage chair.

episodes.name: Arcade
episodes.overview: Dave worries that the past will repeat itself when an arcade game, Stargate Defender, is installed in the hallway. Lisa and Dave take the SATs to prove they're not getting dumber. Bill is obsessed with the stale, plastic, leathery sandwiches from a vending machine.

episodes.name: Halloween
episodes.overview: Mr. James requests that the reticent staffers wear costumes to his Halloween party. Lisa convinces everyone to dress up by promising that Dave will wear the most outlandish costume ever. A psychic tells Bill the exact date of his death..36 years in the future.

episodes.name: Awards Show
episodes.overview: Dave believes WNYX will overcome its jinx and finally win the local broadcasting awards. Matthew believes the office is infested with ants.

episodes.name: Daydream
episodes.overview: Daydreams plague staffers on an unbelievably hot day. Among others, Beth fantasizes that she's being stalked by Matthew, who's taking on horror movie guises; and Joe dreams he turned each of the staffers into androids.

episodes.name: Movie Star
episodes.overview: James Caan visits WNYX to study Bill and prepare for an upcoming film role, but gets distracted and ultimately enthralled by a nervous Matthew. Dave decides to buy a television for Lisa, revealing his passion for Green Acres. Jimmy takes Beth and Catherine to a Knicks game.

episodes.name: Stocks
episodes.overview: Matthew returns from a Japanese vacation bearing gifts, including a katana for Dave. Mr. James teaches Beth the intricacies of the stock market.

episodes.name: Christmas
episodes.overview: With everyone anxious to leave work and head off on holidays, Dave finds himself doing everybody's job and delaying his trip to visit his parents with Lisa. Also Bill recruits Beth for a radio ad only to discover the director wants her and not him.

episodes.name: The Trainer
episodes.overview: All of WNYX is up in arms when they discover Dave is actually a Canadian, not a mid-westerner. Bill joins a health club. Dave tries to teach Jimmy table manners for his upcoming dinner with the president.

episodes.name: Rap
episodes.overview: Bill is outraged when he discovers that rap music has lyrics...offensive lyrics; Lisa is voted 'Cutest Reporter in New York' and attends a photo shoot with Catherine and Beth.

episodes.name: Led Zeppelin Boxed Set
episodes.overview: Matthew, in his own mind, becomes the 'King of the Office' when he loses his temper and punches Bill. Matthew's reign of terror, including ordering various staffers to fetch his lunch, alienates the entire office. Meanwhile, Jimmy tries to best a Three Card Monte dealer at his own game.

episodes.name: Complaint Box
episodes.overview: A newly installed complaint box makes Dave's life miserable. Mr. James goes fishing, but thanks to Joe's invention, the Garelli 5000, stays in contact with the office via satellite hookup.

episodes.name: Rose Bowl
episodes.overview: WNYX staffers evaluate their co-workers, leading to problems based on Matthew's belief that Bill is a God. Jimmy buys fake movie memorabilia, unaware that the sled from Citizen Kane was named 'Rosebud' not 'Rose Bowl'. Joe represents Jimmy in a lawsuit against the man who sold the items.

episodes.name: Kids
episodes.overview: Jimmy implements a program allowing kids into the station to learn about radio, but ditches the students to hit on their teacher. Dave searches for a stash of dirty magazines.

episodes.name: Airport
episodes.overview: With Bill and Dave stuck in a St. Louis airport, Lisa takes command of the office. Her first task: stop Joe and Catherine from going to a movie. Beth and Matthew go to Bill's 'pleasure palace' of an apartment to water his plants. Back in St. Louis, Dave teaches Bill that being polite has its rewards.

episodes.name: Twins
episodes.overview: Matthew's 'identical' twin brother visits. Most of WNYX's furniture is repossessed when the budget is drastically slashed to accommodate a staffer's secret raise.

episodes.name: Office Feud
episodes.overview: Joe engages in office warfare with the new noisy environmentalists upstairs. Catherine takes offense at Bill's newest sponsor, Rocket Fuel Malt Liquor. Lisa covers a White House Easter Egg hunt.

episodes.name: Our Fiftieth Episode
episodes.overview: Bill is committed to an asylum when he's judged mentally incompetent. Lisa is forced to do the 'McNeal Perspective' with Joe in Bill's absence.

episodes.name: Sleeping
episodes.overview: Jimmy suffers a heart attack. His lawyer insists Jimmy stay in the break room while recovering from his coma. Lisa realizes she hasn't completed all her goals in life, and decides to have a baby.

episodes.name: The Real Deal
episodes.overview: When Bill and producer Lisa's new show 'The Real Deal' is on the verge of cancellation, they do everything in their power to recruit Jerry Seinfeld to appear. Matthew reveals that he's never gone 'all the way' before.

episodes.name: Mistake
episodes.overview: Matthew is no longer the weirdest person in the office, when a strange temp comes in. Dave is featured in a national magazine where he inexplicably insults each staff member...and reveals his passion for tap dancing.

episodes.name: Space
episodes.overview: NewsRadio in Outer Space. The year is 2228, humankind is nearly extinct and those who remain are constantly on the run from killer robots. Matthew dates an android. Dave and Lisa discuss moving in together after 93 years dating. Joe, after living in suspended animation for 83 years, tries to fix the life support system.

episodes.name: Injury
episodes.overview: Matthew faces a large medical bill when he's injured while goofing off around the office. A sympathetic Dave claims it was a work related mishap, earning Matthew Workman's comp. Mr. James and his lawyer, Roger, search for the truth. Meanwhile, Bill takes offense at a rival stations' use of the word 'penis' and air several McNeal reports using the same word.

episodes.name: Jumper
episodes.overview: Bill tries to get an exclusive on-air story when a suicidal man is perched outside Dave's window.

episodes.name: Plan Bee
episodes.overview: Jimmy hires Andrea, an efficiency expert, when the station needs to cut funds. The staffers rally around an inept Matthew to try to preserve his job. Bill auditions for a television job.

episodes.name: The Public Domain
episodes.overview: Dave tries to get Matthew rehired amidst chaos. Andrea hires a man to share Dave's Job, Jimmy brings a camera crew into the office to film a documentary, and Bill prepares for a new career as a singing political satirist a la Mark Russell.

episodes.name: Super Karate Monkey Death Car
episodes.overview: Andrea forces the staff to take lie detector tests. Lisa fears she will not pass the test due to her extensive criminal past. Jimmy has his book, which failed in the U.S., translated into Japanese then back into English.

episodes.name: French Diplomacy
episodes.overview: Dave and Lisa breakup. Bill gets himself into trouble when he advocates the beating of foreign diplomats. Matthew opens his own dentistry practice.

episodes.name: Pure Evil
episodes.overview: Dave hatches a scheme of 'pure evil' to get his job as news director back, including approving Bill's obscenity laced imaginary conversations with the president. Lisa tries hard to do a good job as news director. Matthew lives in the office.

episodes.name: Catherine Moves On
episodes.overview: Each staffer offers up a very different version of events of the day Catherine announces she's leaving WNYX. Joe realizes that Catherine's always yearned for him.

episodes.name: Stupid Holiday Charity Talent Show
episodes.overview: Dave unveils a previously hidden talent to compete in a charity talent show. If a WNYX staff member wins, Mr. James will re-hire Matthew in this incredibly hilarious episode.

episodes.name: The Secret of Management
episodes.overview: Bill hire's a gentleman's gentleman, Cadbury, to oversee his life. Mr. James teaches Lisa 'The Secret of Management'. Matthew feels left out when Bill doesn't congratulate him on being rehired.

episodes.name: Look Who's Talking
episodes.overview: Bill announces plans to adopt a child. Beth and Joe attend a charity bachelor auction, with Beth impersonating a duchess and Joe playing her homosexual bachelor friend, to bid on Mr. James.

episodes.name: Chock
episodes.overview: Dave finds it hard to say no when his old college a cappella singing group 'Chock Full o' Notes' reunites for Dave's 32nd birthday, hoping to take the pop charts by storm. Meanwhile, Lisa tries to motivate Matthew without reducing him to tears. Joe has a beef with one of Dave's friends.

episodes.name: Who's the Boss? (1)
episodes.overview: After Bill pesters Lisa once again, Dave and Lisa hatch an evil plan to make Bill the boss to teach him a lesson. Bill's reign is eerily efficient. Joe goes on a sympathy strike to support another of Mr. James companies.

episodes.name: Who's the Boss? (2)
episodes.overview: Mr. James announces an election for station manager, which neither Dave nor Lisa want to win. Joe's dysfunctional brothers visit the station to plan a surprise party for their parents. Matthew runs for floor fire marshal.

episodes.name: Security Door
episodes.overview: Dave struggles vainly to get the staffers to properly use the recently installed security door. Bill enlists Lisa to do the negotiating when he's offered a job in a blue jean's commercial.

episodes.name: Big Brother
episodes.overview: Matthew is assigned a Big Brother, who makes eyes at Beth; Joe, Jimmy, and Bill try to uncover Lisa's love life.

episodes.name: Beep, Beep
episodes.overview: Mr. James gives Matthew a small toy car. Mr. James urges Dave and Lisa to get back together when a secret study reveals they're more productive when they're a couple.

episodes.name: Balloon
episodes.overview: Jimmy plans to go around the world in a hot air balloon, until Dave finds that he is full of ""hot air"". Meanwhile, Bill switches from cigarettes to chewing tobacco.

episodes.name: Copy Machine
episodes.overview: The office mourns the loss of Ted, from accounting, until Dave realizes that nobody knew him, at all.

episodes.name: Monster Rancher
episodes.overview: Matthew takes Lisa on a date. The office has trouble adapting to a new intern, Mr. James' nephew, Walt.

Joe fights Matthew in a no-holds-barred match at Mr. James' men's club smoker. Bill is extremely worried that Walt will ask Lisa on a date. We learn Dave's technique for getting rid of an unwanted visitor; act insane.

episodes.name: Jackass Junior High
episodes.overview: Lisa is treated like a male by office co-workers, who revert to their boorish selves when all other females are out sick.

episodes.name: Sinking Ship
episodes.overview: The episode spoofs the movie Titanic, where Walt and Dave sketch Lisa nude and give her heart shaped necklaces.  Soon, though, the ship starts to sink...

episodes.name: Bill Moves On
episodes.overview: The news crew copes with the loss of their good friend, Bill, after he dies of a heart attack.

episodes.name: Meet The Max Louis
episodes.overview: Jon Lovitz joins the cast as Max Louis, hired because of a connection to Bill.  The idea of ""Y2K"" wreaks havoc at the office.

episodes.name: Lucky Burger
episodes.overview: It comes out that Max doctored his resume; Lisa goes undercover at a restaurant.

episodes.name: Noise
episodes.overview: Dave learns he has high blood pressure, causing Joe to install a sound machine.  Matthew becomes motherly toward Max, after a conversation with Beth.

episodes.name: Flowers for Matthew
episodes.overview: Joe creates a ""smart drink"", with extreme results; Lisa becomes Max's confidante.

episodes.name: Jail
episodes.overview: After a case of mistaken identity, Jimmy is sent to jail.  His vice president, Johnny, takes over.

episodes.name: The Lam
episodes.overview: Lisa admits her attraction to Johnny; Dave must exploit their relationship to protect Jimmy.

episodes.name: Clash of the Titans
episodes.overview: Jimmy is freed from prison, to realize that Johnny has stolen his empire.

episodes.name: Boston
episodes.overview: Dave tries to tape a message for students at his alma matter; Lisa tries to cure her speech impediment.

episodes.name: Spooky Rapping Crypt
episodes.overview: Beth wants to start profit-sharing; Matthew thinks of abuse after undergoing hypnosis.

episodes.name: Stinkbutt
episodes.overview: Dave fights to hang Joe and Beth's strange painting in the lobby; Matthew starts dressing like Lisa.

episodes.name: Apartment
episodes.overview: Dave and Lisa fight for an apartment, which Max decides he wants; Joe and Beth ""fix-up"" the show's website.

episodes.name: Towers
episodes.overview: Matthew's 30th birthday causes him to adopt the persona of an 18 year old.  Lisa protests Jimmy's plan to build a 200 story skyscraper.

episodes.name: Hair
episodes.overview: Jimmy's fear of hippies causes him to blow a big deal; Max and Beth spoil Lisa's dog.

episodes.name: Assistant
episodes.overview: Lisa's new assistant turns Joe and Dave into rivals; Max complains about the lack of sofa in the men's room.

episodes.name: Wino
episodes.overview: The formerly evil Johnny Johnson returns to the station, now a homeless wino, to claim Lisa's hand in marriage. Lisa finds it hard to resist Johnny... despite his noxious odor.

episodes.name: Wedding
episodes.overview: Lisa gets married to Johnny, despite Dave's attempt to talk her out of it.

episodes.name: Ploy
episodes.overview: Max pretends to quit to hopefully get Beth to beg him to stay. When the ploy fails, Dave has to swallow his pride to get Max back. Lisa's new hyphenated last name, Miller-Johnson, irks both Joe and Matthew.

episodes.name: Padded Suit
episodes.overview: Dave vents aggression on the staff, threatening to fire someone. Matthew wears a padded suit to learn Joe's karate-like martial art, Joe-jitsu. Mr. James leads a crusade against Mother's Day.

episodes.name: Freaky Friday
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Matthew switch places for a day, with life altering results.  Dave bans max from the breakroom.

episodes.name: Retirement
episodes.overview: Mr. James announces that he's selling the station and retiring to New Hampshire. Dave believes it's a ploy. Lisa organizes a retirement party to convince Mr. James to stay.

episodes.name: New Hampshire
episodes.overview: Jimmy returns to finalize the sale of the station and tries to persuade one staff member to relocate to New Hampshire with him.
